comment.author: 69645150@N05
comment._content: George Ivor Le Duc Neal was born in Paddington in 1886, the son of George (a builder & contractor) and his wife Alice.  He had two younger brothers who went on to become a major and a captain in WW1.

comment.author: 69755091@N07
comment._content: Medal Index Card states that he arrived in France on the 23rd January 1915. He was entitled to the 1915 Star, British War Medal and Victory Medal.

comment.author: 69699566@N03
comment._content:
Probate Records
George Ivor Neal of Pinner House Pinner Middlesex died 15th June 1915 at or near Ypres Flanders Probate in London on 24th November 1915 awarded to George Neal Builder total sum of Effects £74.5s

comment.author: 69699566@N03
comment._content:
Baptisms 

(sister) Julia Frances Jane Neal was Baptised on 25th January 1885 at St Peter Paddington Parents George & Alice Julia Neal all off 18 Walterton Road Paddington George Neal Snr occupation Builder

George Ivor Le Duc Neal was Baptised on 27th June 1886 at St Peter Paddington Parents George & Alice Julia Neal all off 18 Walterton Road Paddington George Neal Snr occupation Builder

(brother) Archibald Charles Neal born 30th January 1888 was Baptised on 12th February 1888 at Christ Church Brondesbury London Parents George & Alice Julia Neal all off 36 Priory Park Road Brondesbury London George Neal Snr occupation Builder

(sister) Doris Sybil Neal born 11th March 1891 was Baptised on 5th April 1891 at St Paul Kilburn Square Parents George & Alice Julia Neal all off 42 Kingsley Road Willesden George Neal Snr occupation Builder

comment.author: 69699566@N03
comment._content:
Deaths
(Mother) Alice Julia Neal 54yrs registered death Jun 1917 Hendon Middlesex Vol.3a Page 331
(Father) George Neal 86yrs registered death Dec 1946 Hampstead London Vol.5c Page 851 Possible trace
(Brother) Archibald Charles Neal 63yrs registered death Sep 1951 Taunton Somerset Vol.7c Page 187
(Sister) Doris Sybil Yates nee Neal 61yrs registered death Sep 1953 Marylebone London Vol.5d Page 204
(Sister) Julia Frances Julia Neal 74yrs registered death Dec 1959 Wandsworth London Vol.5d Page 789

comment.author: 69699566@N03
comment._content:
Marriages
(Parents) George Neal married Alice Julia Le Duc marriage registered Dec 1882 Kensington Vol.1a Page 385

(Sister) Doris Sybil Neal married Ernest G Yates marriage registered Jun 1911 St George Hanover Square Vol.1a Page 1094
Doris & Ernest appear to have had a set of twins; Cedric Ernest George Yates & David W Yates registered births Jun 1912 Hampstead Vol.1a Page 1078

comment.author: 69699566@N03
comment._content:
1871 UK Census
41 Cornwall Road Paddington London Parish of St Mary Paddington
This house appears to be a private school with 3 women governesses running it as George Neal’s mother is recorded as residing here:
Alice Le Duc 9 Boarder Scholar place of birth not known 

(Alice Le Duc being George Ivor Le Duc Neals' mother)

comment.author: 69699566@N03
comment._content:
(brother) Archibald Charles Neal married Gertrude M Thomas registered marriage Dec 1919 Maidstone Vol.2a Page 2271
They had a daughter Diane Mary Neal birth registered Mar 1921 Hampstead Vol.1a Page 970

(Niece) Diana Mary Neal married Major John Andrew Comyn, son of Colonel Lewis James Comyn and Esther Mary Egan, on 30th April 1948. Diane and Major John Andrew Comyn were divorced in 1961.
Children of Diana Mary Neal and Major John Andrew Comyn:-
John Archibald Comyn born 21st April 1950 - died 21st April1950
Charles Lewis Comyn born 1st April 1952
David John Comyn  b. 14 May 1954
Major John Andrew Comyn was born 28th August 1915 and was the son of Colonel Lewis James Comyn and Esther Mary Egan. 
Major John Andrew Comyn  was educated at Wellington College, Wellington, Berkshire, England. Having fought in the Second World War, in North Africa, where he became a POW. Retired from the military in 1950, with the rank of Major, late of the King's Royal Irish Hussars.Became Director of Saintrutt & Parker (Farms) Ltd & was Invested as a Member, Order of the British Empire (M.B.E.) in 1968 & was also  Invested as a Fellow, Chartered Insitutute of Secretaries (F.C.I.S.). Lived in 1976 at Terling, Chelmsford, Essex, England.

comment.author: 69798423@N03
comment._content:
SDGW Info:

Name: George Ivor Neal
Residence: Pinner
Death Date: 16 Jun 1915
Death Location: France & Flanders
Enlistment Location: Armoury House
Rank: Private
Regiment: Honourable Artillery Company
Battalion: 1st
Number: 1976
Type of Casualty: Killed in action
Theatre of War: Western European Theatre

CWGC Info:

Name: NEAL, GEORGE IVOR 
Initials: G I 
Nationality: United Kingdom 
Rank: Private 
Regiment/Service: Honourable Artillery Company 
Unit Text: 1st Bn. 
Date of Death: 16/06/1915 
Service No: 1976 
Casualty Type: Commonwealth War Dead 
Grave/Memorial Reference: Panel 9. 
Memorial: YPRES (MENIN GATE) MEMORIAL 

His service record survived the Blitz and shows that he enlisted on 5th September 1914 and had only served in 285 days service prior to his death.
